original_text: It has recently been demonstrated [15] (see also [13] and references therein) that for a self-dual background the two-loop QED effective action takes a remarkably simple form that is very similar to the one-loop action in the same background. There are expectations that this similarity persists at higher loops, and therefore there should be some remarkable structure encoded in the all-loop effective action for gauge theories. In the supersymmetric case, one has to replace the requirement of self-duality by that of relaxed super self-duality [16] in order to arrive at conclusions similar to those given in [15]. Further progress in this direction may be achieved through the analysis of N=2 covariant supergraphs. Finally, we believe that the results of this Letter may be helpful in the context of the conjectured correspondence [17–19] between the D3-brane action in AdS5×S5 and the low-energy action for N=4 SU(N) SYM on its Coulomb branch, with the gauge group SU(N) spontaneously broken to SU(N−1)×U(1). There have appeared two independent F6 tests of this conjecture [19,20], with conflicting conclusions. The approach advocated here provides the opportunity for a further test.
original_translation: Recientemente se ha demostrado [15] (ver también [13] y referencias incluidas) que para un fondo autodual, la acción efectiva de QED a dos bucles adquiere una forma notablemente simple que es muy similar a la acción a un bucle en el mismo fondo. Existen expectativas de que esta similitud se mantenga en bucles superiores, por lo que debería haber alguna estructura notable codificada en la acción efectiva de todos los bucles para las teorías de gauge. En el caso supersimétrico, se debe reemplazar el requisito de autodualidad por el de autodualidad super relajada [16] para llegar a conclusiones similares a las presentadas en [15]. Se puede lograr un progreso adicional en esta dirección a través del análisis de supergráficos covariantes N=2. Finalmente, creemos que los resultados de esta carta pueden ser útiles en el contexto de la correspondencia conjeturada [17–19] entre la acción de la D3-brana en AdS5×S5 y la acción de baja energía para N=4 SU(N) SYM en su rama de Coulomb, con el grupo de gauge SU(N) roto espontáneamente a SU(N−1)×U(1). Han aparecido dos pruebas F6 independientes de esta conjetura [19,20], con conclusiones conflictivas. El enfoque defendido aquí brinda la oportunidad para una prueba adicional.

In the supersymmetric case, one has to replace the requirement of self-duality by that of relaxed super self-duality [16] in order to arrive at conclusions similar to those given in [15].
Further progress in this direction may be achieved through the analysis of N=2 covariant supergraphs.

Finally, we believe that the results of this Letter may be helpful in the context of the conjectured correspondence [17–19] between the D3-brane action in AdS5×S5 and the low-energy action for N=4 SU(N) SYM on its Coulomb branch, with the gauge group SU(N) spontaneously broken to SU(N−1)×U(1).
There have appeared two independent F6 tests of this conjecture [19,20], with conflicting conclusions.
The approach advocated here provides the opportunity for a further test.

There are expectations that this similarity persists at higher loops, and therefore there should be some remarkable structure encoded in the
all-loop effective action
for gauge theories.
In the supersymmetric case, one has to replace the requirement of self-duality by that of relaxed super self-duality [16] in order to arrive at conclusions similar to those given in [15].

The approach advocated here provides the opportunity for a further test.

SU(N) roto espontáneamente a SU(N−1)×U(1). Han aparecido dos pruebas F6 independientes de esta conjetura [19,20], con conclusiones conflictivas. El enfoque defendido aquí brinda la oportunidad para una prueba adicional.

original_annotated_sentences: It has recently been demonstrated [15] (see also [13] and references therein) that for a self-dual background the two-loop QED effective action takes a remarkably simple form that is very similar to the one-loop action in the same background.

There are expectations that this similarity persists at
higher loops
, and therefore there should be some remarkable structure encoded in the all-loop effective action for gauge theories.
In the supersymmetric case, one has to replace the requirement of self-duality by that of relaxed super self-duality [16] in order to arrive at conclusions similar to those given in [15].
Further progress in this direction may be achieved through the analysis of N=2 covariant supergraphs.

Finally, we believe that the results of this Letter may be helpful in the context of the conjectured correspondence [17–19] between the D3-brane action in AdS5×S5 and the low-energy action for N=4 SU(N) SYM on its Coulomb branch, with the gauge group SU(N) spontaneously broken to SU(N−1)×U(1).
There have appeared two independent F6 tests of this conjecture [19,20], with conflicting conclusions.
The approach advocated here provides the opportunity for a further test.
original_annotated_samples:
There are expectations that this similarity persists at
higher loops
, and therefore there should be some remarkable structure encoded in the all-loop effective action for gauge theories.
translated_annotated_samples:
Existen expectativas de que esta similitud se mantenga en
bucles superiores
, por lo que debería haber alguna estructura notable codificada en la acción efectiva de todos los bucles para las teorías de gauge.
higher loops.translated_text:
Recientemente se ha demostrado [15] (ver también [13] y referencias incluidas) que para un fondo autodual, la acción efectiva de QED a dos bucles adquiere una forma notablemente simple que es muy similar a la acción a un bucle en el mismo fondo. Existen expectativas de que esta similitud se mantenga en
bucles superiores
, por lo que debería haber alguna estructura notable codificada en la acción efectiva de todos los bucles para las teorías de gauge. En el caso supersimétrico, se debe reemplazar el requisito de autodualidad por el de autodualidad super relajada [16] para llegar a conclusiones similares a las presentadas en [15]. Se puede lograr un progreso adicional en esta dirección a través del análisis de supergráficos covariantes N=2. Finalmente, creemos que los resultados de esta carta pueden ser útiles en el contexto de la correspondencia conjeturada [17–19] entre la acción de la D3-brana en AdS5×S5 y la acción de baja energía para N=4 SU(N) SYM en su rama de Coulomb, con el grupo de gauge SU(N) roto espontáneamente a SU(N−1)×U(1). Han aparecido dos pruebas F6 independientes de esta conjetura [19,20], con conclusiones conflictivas. El enfoque defendido aquí brinda la oportunidad para una prueba adicional.

two-loop QED effective action.translated_key: acción efectiva de QED a dos bucles
original_annotated_sentences:
It has recently been demonstrated [15] (see also [13] and references therein) that for a self-dual background the
two-loop QED effective action
takes a remarkably simple form that is very similar to the one-loop action in the same background.
There are expectations that this similarity persists at higher loops, and therefore there should be some remarkable structure encoded in the all-loop effective action for gauge theories.
In the supersymmetric case, one has to replace the requirement of self-duality by that of relaxed super self-duality [16] in order to arrive at conclusions similar to those given in [15].
Further progress in this direction may be achieved through the analysis of N=2 covariant supergraphs.

Finally, we believe that the results of this Letter may be helpful in the context of the conjectured correspondence [17–19] between the D3-brane action in AdS5×S5 and the low-energy action for N=4 SU(N) SYM on its Coulomb branch, with the gauge group SU(N) spontaneously broken to SU(N−1)×U(1).
There have appeared two independent F6 tests of this conjecture [19,20], with conflicting conclusions.
The approach advocated here provides the opportunity for a further test.
